itemDescription: civil servant and consumer rights campaigner (1910-1987)

wikipedia_page.main: Dame (Dorothy) Elizabeth Ackroyd (13 August 1910 – 28 June 1987) was a British civil servant and first director of an innovative Consumer Council, which ran from 1963 to 1971. She worked for a number of associations, councils and boards after her retirement, including as president and chairperson of the Patients Association.

response: * Dorothy Elizabeth Ackroyd, Director, Consumer Council.
